alert.note: Alert for Logan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 20 at 10:17AM EDT until July 20 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Kentucky, including the following counties, Allen, Barren, Clinton, Cumberland, Logan, Metcalfe, Monroe, Simpson and Warren. * WHEN...Until 7 PM CDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - As convection from southeast Missouri and southern Illinois moves east-southeast into south central Kentucky, it will enter an environment favorable for efficient rainfall. High rainfall rates and training of storms could lead to localized flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
